title: Hanta Fever
subject: Microbiology
description: Questions about Hanta virus infection and pathophysiology

questions.explanation: Hanta virus is transmitted through inhalation of aerosolized rodent excreta.

questions.questionText: Which enzyme is responsible for the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II?
questions.explanation: ACE converts angiotensin I to the active angiotensin II in the lungs.

questions.questionText: Based on the ECG shown above, what is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.imageAlt: ECG showing irregular rhythm with absent P waves
questions.explanation: The ECG shows irregularly irregular rhythm with absent P waves, which is characteristic of atrial fibrillation.

questions.questionText: The primary neurotransmitter at sympathetic ganglia is:
questions.explanation: Sympathetic ganglia use acetylcholine as their primary neurotransmitter.

questions.questionText: What pathological finding is most evident in this chest X-ray?
questions.imageAlt: Chest X-ray showing bilateral lung infiltrates
questions.explanation: The chest X-ray shows bilateral infiltrates consistent with pneumonia affecting both lungs.

questions.questionText: Which part of the nephron is primarily responsible for glucose reabsorption?
questions.explanation: Glucose is primarily reabsorbed in the proximal convoluted tubule via sodium-glucose transporters.

questions.questionText: Based on this histological image, what type of tissue is shown?
questions.imageAlt: Microscopic image showing cellular tissue structure
questions.explanation: The histological image shows striated muscle with intercalated discs, characteristic of cardiac muscle.
